SENT.plain: We report a case of bilateral internal carotid artery (ICA) stenosis treated with stenting
A 78-year-old man suffered from vascular dementia and left hemiparesis, and, by magnetic resonance angiogram (MRA), was diagnosed as having bilateral ICA stenosis

Cerebral angiogram showed severe, bilateral ICA stenosis (right; 88%, left; 93%) and xenon single photon emission tomography (SPECT) showed severely decreased cerebral blood flow (CBF) and cerebrovascular reactivity (CVR)
We performed bilateral carotid angioplasty with self-expanding stents
Both CBF and CVR were improved bilaterally after the operation
The patient was discharged without neurological deficits
Carotid stenting may be an alternative treatment for severe ischemia caused by severe, bilateral ICA stenosis
